dogecoin.text: @SaherAhwal @ParikPatelCFA thankfully dogecoin has the properties of money and currency :D
dogecoin is a community with a currency, the value is in the community
@FastchargeD @DogeMemeGuild @BillyM2k @JRossNicoll @itsALLrisky @IamUpshod @DogecoinRise @dogecoin_devs for the dogecoin core team

@BillyM2k @dogecoin_devs I love how the creator of bitcoin handed off the project to a developer, and you guys handed dogecoin off to a team of developers. I also love that Satoshi is a Japanese name, and doge is a Japanese dog. So many similarities that are totally accidental. :D
The #dogecoin community is the world's most powerful marketing community.
@MacNCheddarr @dogecoin you haven't seen anything yet, a future without banks, much wow :D

@salimozz @SpreadTasty @mcuban dogecoin developers contribute to bitcoin core, really shouldn't be treating these like companies, it's open source software with different monetary policies, it's not a competition
@trader_colorado @BillyM2k dogecoin is money with the properties of currency.... the dollar is currency
@ShimonShak @BillyM2k These are all monetary experiments, and based on previous monetary experiments throughout history, dogecoin likely has the best chance of being a widely accepted currency.

@questorianist @BillyM2k dogecoin wasn't designed to be an investment vehicle, it's designed to be used as a currency, humans never had a form of currency/money with a cap in history, as an example, we'll always find more gold.

@Brovich21 @tcjdesign @D7ZZ77 @GoldTelegraph_ You don't get to decide, free markets will, dogecoin already has more transactions in dollar terms per day than bitcoin and ethereum, and it's just getting started. We should look back at these tweets 10 years from now :D

@tcjdesign @Brovich21 @D7ZZ77 @GoldTelegraph_ Dogecoin will be the reserve currency of the world, it has the properties of currency and money, and offers freedoms and issuance stability that no national currency can.
@divinegrackle @GoodShibe Dogecoin is a neutral platform, it treats everyone and everything equally, the users already pay a transaction tax in the form of fees that go to the miners.
@BillyM2k @tyler dogecoin miners sound more like jet engines :D
@AnnaeusLucius @istanbulmasseur @cz_binance and obviously people that support your favourite coins jumped on the dogecoin rocket, took their gains, and then dumped into your favourite coins
@AnnaeusLucius @istanbulmasseur @cz_binance even when dogecoin was launched it was able to bring in so many new people into the cryptocurrency community, and overall that benefits everyone

@AnnaeusLucius @istanbulmasseur @cz_binance dogecoin will always be the fun money that was created as a joke, when it dips the community makes others laugh so they don't freak out, get depressed, and panic sell xD

@CryptoFoxHound @RogueAnalyst @woonomic @RaoulGMI It's like $50 to send the dogecoin killer to another address xD https://t.co/rBk9UWSf4E

@TMFUltraLong You're talking about inflation which is a property of money supply and money velocity, you can't compare the two things. Compare US Money supply inflation with Dogecoin money supply inflation if you want it to be fair.
@Dog66Bull @GoodShibe they know bitcoin is too expensive to use as a currency so dogecoin is a real threat
@coin_artist careful, don't you know that dogecoin is a national security risk according to CNBC? xD

@Halio1984 @GoodShibe @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation They don't want that, they don't want a central entity, both attempts to create a foundation collapsed. Every time we placed people in charge, it always backfired on us.
@CryptoCarrot95 @rjchecco @BillyM2k @mcuban I believe in the dogecoin community, anyone can contribute to making it better, it didn't want rock star developers/leadership.
@CryptoCarrot95 @rjchecco @BillyM2k @mcuban dogecoin doesn't require validators, it's a trustless system, but the tradeoff is slower settlement as the network needs to reach consensus.
@helladdict69 @kribbimuenze @YouTube I'm like a dogecoin node, I don't trust anyone, only believe in results xD
@MJ88576770 we aren't forced to use the dogecoin core client
@MJ88576770 dogecoin doesn't have a governance structure, he could release his own client if he wanted to be the lead developer.
@Halio1984 @andyypants @GoodShibe @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation @elonmusk could you imagine how high the fees would be if only 790,000 - 7,900,000 people could actually use it xD

@Halio1984 @andyypants @GoodShibe @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation @elonmusk ~17.7544 days if only 0.1% of the population used it
~1.7754 days if only 0.01% of the population used

@Halio1984 @andyypants @GoodShibe @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation @elonmusk transactions per day = 5.15(tx/s) * 86400(s/day) = 444,960
global population = 7,900,000,000
7,900,000,000 / 444,960 = 17754 days

If we could only submit a single transaction, the last person would have to wait 17754 days before their transaction went through!
@Halio1984 @andyypants @GoodShibe @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation @elonmusk before we would joke about the guy buying a pizza for 10,000 BTC, and now the fee will buy you one or more pizzas xD

@andyypants @GoodShibe @Halio1984 @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation @elonmusk I think bitcoin's power usage is fine, the main issue I have with it is we need to be able to process more on-chain transactions. If we can't then it's not really worth the energy consumption.
@Halio1984 @GoodShibe @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation @elonmusk I'm for governance, just think the level of government we have is pretty nuts :P
@andyypants @GoodShibe @Halio1984 @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation @elonmusk issue is if we drop the reward, the miners will have less to sell, so in theory the price would rise even further xD

@andyypants @GoodShibe @Halio1984 @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation @elonmusk we're not even close to our max throughput yet, but it is something the developers are worried about, and it's something that will need to be solved at some point

@GoodShibe @Halio1984 @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation @elonmusk If bitcoin became the currency of the world, only 0.01-0.1% of the global population would be able to make on-chain transactions. No wonder the banks don't hate it xD

@GoodShibe @Halio1984 @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation @elonmusk Until we have a good scaling solution, the best bet is to have many chains, the on-chain capacity of a single chain just isn't enough to eliminate the need for banks.

@GoodShibe @Halio1984 @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation @elonmusk If dogecoin could provide a high enough transaction throughput for the global population, we wouldn't even need nation states anymore. xD
@Halio1984 @GoodShibe @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation @elonmusk someone could even remove the doge and change the font if they wanted to
@Halio1984 @GoodShibe @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation @elonmusk if they all disappeared the network would live on, and if someone wanted to continue their work and earn our trust, they could
@Halio1984 @GoodShibe @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation @elonmusk the developers rejecting his monetary offer could be why he respects the developers so much

@Halio1984 @GoodShibe @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation @elonmusk keep in mind, dogecoin isn't about @elonmusk, it's about the community, he just happens to be part of the community. If he wanted to setup a foundation he could have.
@GoodShibe @Halio1984 @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation maybe the third attempt will be successful, who knows xD

@Halio1984 @GoodShibe @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation we didn't have to work on rosetta, it was only for community building and to demonstrate that development was active, it was really a task for the coinbase engineers which already get paid $200-550k/year

@Halio1984 @GoodShibe @dogecoin_devs @freebsdfndation people chose to trust them as maintainers but really anyone could have maintained those projects, we don't need official titles or legal entities within certain countries
@Doge420Viking what elon wants wont be solved with a software update, the entire infrastructure of the dogecoin network would need to be upgraded
@TMFUltraLong @APompliano Elon proposed a challenge (increase system throughput), and instead of accepting the challenge, they just started attacking Elon and the dogecoin community.

@ShaneTrammel @elonmusk @itsALLrisky Ya, not a competition, ideally dogecoin would continue the original bitcoin mission of becoming a global currency that doesn't require banks.

@MJ88576770 They are trying to solve different problems, dogecoin is the best suited to be a currency.
You really think Tesla bought bitcoins just to sit on them? It's very likely that they have engineers working on bitcoin and dogecoin.

@dannysachs @EmiMelker It's not even a competition, they'll co-exist, bitcoin wants to be store of value (digital gold), dogecoin wants to be a digital currency.
@helladdict69 @paypl1 @elonmusk @dogecoin_devs @Cocochaneladair @leastImAlive @MattWallace888 @davidgokhshtein Was using 100% of the upload bandwidth for days (no dips), was crazy.

@paypl1 @helladdict69 @elonmusk @dogecoin_devs @Cocochaneladair @leastImAlive @MattWallace888 @davidgokhshtein I have a feeling you'll have a long list to follow, a lot of nodes suddenly appeared on the dogecoin testnet, it was pretty nuts.

@paypl1 @helladdict69 @elonmusk @dogecoin_devs @Cocochaneladair @leastImAlive @MattWallace888 @davidgokhshtein It's likely not a lie, there's no such thing as official doge devs, it's open source and decentralized.

@paypl1 @helladdict69 @elonmusk @dogecoin_devs @Cocochaneladair @leastImAlive @MattWallace888 @davidgokhshtein It's an open source project, so anyone can be a doge dev, there's a possibility he has a team of engineers working on doge.
@PaulieKingz @GoldTelegraph_ @elonmusk the dogecoin community has introduced so many new people to cryptocurrencies, and they are constantly attacked due to its popularity, it really needs to stop.

@PaulieKingz @GoldTelegraph_ @elonmusk actually the community brought it upon themselves with their toxicity, bitcoin and dogecoin can co-exist, they decided to declare war on a community that was just having fun.
@LNJunkies @dannysachs @EmiMelker What does this have to do with dogecoin? It also has a layer 1 scaling issue that needs to be resolved at some point.

@epsryn_foe @dannysachs @EmiMelker Bitcoin is an open source project, people working on other projects (including dogecoin) have contributed to bitcoin. Its interface displays a meme, but it also just happens to have a good monetary policy for a currency.
